intro: Prunus jamasakura f. kohokuensis, commonly known as the Kohoku cherry, is a cultivar of the Japanese cherry tree. It is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in early spring, contrasting with its dark green foliage. The tree typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has a rounded, compact form. It is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and parks, particularly in regions with mild winters. The leaves turn a vibrant red in the autumn, adding to its seasonal appeal.
